subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Radio Shack Model 12-469: Used it for the first time today
author: Michael Edwards
full_text:
--0-1308035907-1204854854=:40093
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Here is my problem. I have a digital recorder and it saves the files in WMA format. I tried saving the file in .wav, but it wont let me.  I have a 4 minute tape, but only need about 30 seconds of the tape as that is where I got my response. I am not very technical... This is frustrating as the EVP I got is really clear. i assume I can play the recorder and tape it again with sound recorder but then I lose clarity, I would imagine....  Does media player allow an edit of a file to take out x number of seconds and save to a .wav? have any ideas
.
   
  My dad used to smoke Marlboro.... brings back memories
   
  Mike Edwards Cary, NC

Marlboro63@... wrote:
            Hi Mike,
   
  I am sure there are enough of us here that will help you out with the file.  You can send it to any of us and we would run it thru our software for you and send it back to you in bits and pieces.  I would also recommend cool edit 2.1 for editing the software.  It works great.....
   
  Jeff
   
    In a message dated 3/6/2008 8:39:40 A.M. Central Standard Time, f1cracker75@... writes:
            I used my 12-469 for the first time this morning, and ran a 4 minute tape session. One of the questions I asked was, "When a person dies, do they see a white light?"  After I asked this question the second time, I got a very distinct and crisp YES.  How can I save just that section of the file? Do I need to do that in the recorder, or can I do it in the .wave file I now have saved on my computer of the whole recording.
   
  Mike Edwards Cary, NC
